gurmukhi: ੴ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satiguroo Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੧ ਨਿੰਦਕ
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satiguroo Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ਕੁਤਾ ਰਾਜ ਬਹਾਲੀਅੈ ਫਿਰਿ ਚਕੀ ਚਟੈ
transliteration: Koutaa Raaji Bahaaleeai Dhiri Chakee Chatai.
translation: If a dog is seated on the throne even then it will (like to) lick the flour mill.

gurmukhi: ਸਪੈ ਦੁਧੁ ਪੀਅਾਲੀਅੈ ਵਿਹੁ ਮੁਖਹੁ ਸਟੈ
transliteration: Sapai Dudhu Peeaaleeai Vihu Moukhahu Satai.
translation: If a snake is fed on milk even then it will pour out poison from its mouth.

gurmukhi: ਪਥਰੁ ਪਾਣੀ ਰਖੀਅੈ ਮਨਿ ਹਠੁ ਨ ਘਟੈ
transliteration: Padaru Paanee Rakheeai Mani Hatdu N Ghatai.
translation: If a stone is kept in water even then its hardness does not soften.

gurmukhi: ਚੋਅਾ ਚੰਦਨੁ ਪਰਿਹਰੈ ਖਰੁ ਖੇਹ ਪਲਟੈ
transliteration: Choaa Chandanu Pariharai Karu Khayh Palatai.
translation: Repudiating the perfume and sandalwood-fragrance, the donkey rolls its body in the dust.

gurmukhi: ਤਿੳੁ ਨਿੰਦਕ ਪਰ ਨਿਦਹੁੰ ਹਠਿ ਮੂਲਿ ਨ ਹਟੈ
transliteration: Tiu Nidak Par Nidahoo Hadi Mooli N Hatai.
translation: Similarly the backbiter never gives up (his habit of) backbiting

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪਣ ਹਥੀ ਅਾਪਣੀ ਜੜ ਅਾਪਿ ੳੁਪਟੈ ॥੧॥
transliteration: Aapan Hadeen Aapanee Jarh Aapi Oupatai ?1?
translation: And uproots himselt to destroy his very existence.

gurmukhi: ੨ ਨਿੰਦਕ
translation: The backbiter

gurmukhi: ਕਾੳੁਂ ਕਪੂਰ ਨਾ ਚਖੲੀ ਦੁਰਗੰਧਿ ਸੁਖਾਵੈ
transliteration: Kaaoun Kapoor N Chakhaee Duragandhi Soukhaavai.
translation: Crow never picks up camphor; it likes to have garbage around.

gurmukhi: ਹਾਥੀ ਨੀਰਿ ਨ੍ਹਵਾਲੀਅੈ ਸਿਰਿ ਛਾਰੁ ੳੁਡਾਵੈ
transliteration: Haadee Neeri Nhavaaleeai Siri Chhaaru Udaavai.
translation: The elephant even bathed in water puts dust on its head.

gurmukhi: ਤੁੰਮੇ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਸਿੰਜੀਅੈ ਕੳੁੜਤੁ ਨ ਜਾਵੈ
transliteration: Tounmay Anmrit Sinjeeai Kaurhatu N Jaavai.
translation: The colocynth (tumma) even if irrigated with nectar does not part with its bitterness.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਮਲੁ ਰੁਖੁ ਸਰੇਵੀਅੈ ਫਲੁ ਹਥਿ ਨਾ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Simalu Roukhu Sarayveeai Phalu Hadi N Aavai.
translation: Even if the silk-cotton tree is well served (with water and manure etc.), no fruit is gained from it.

gurmukhi: ਨਿੰਦਕੁ ਨਾਮ ਵਿਹੂਣਿਅਾ ਸਤਿਸੰਗ ਨਾ ਭਾਵੈ
transliteration: Nidaku Naam Vihooniaa Satisang N Bhaavai.
translation: The backbiters being devoid of the neim of the Lord, do not like the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਨ੍ਹਾ ਅਾਗੂ ਜੇ ਥੀਅੈ ਸਭੁ ਸਾਥੁ ਮੁਹਾਵੈ ॥੨॥
transliteration: Annhaa Aagoo Jay Deeai Sabhu Saadu Muhaavai ?2?
translation: If the leader is blind, the whole company is bound to be robbed of (their valuables).

gurmukhi: ੩ ਨਿੰਦਕ
translation: The backbiter

gurmukhi: ਲਸਣੁ ਲੁਕਾੲਿਅਾ ਨਾ ਲੁਕੈ ਬਹਿ ਖਾਜੈ ਕੂਣੈ
transliteration: Lasanu Loukaaiaa Naa Loukay Bahi Khaajai Koonai.
translation: The smell of garlic cannot be concealed even if it is eaten in a remote corner.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਲਾ ਕੰਬਲੁ ੳੁਜਲਾ ਕਿੳੁਂ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਬੂਣੈ
transliteration: Kaalaa Kanbalu Ujalaa Kioun Hoi Saboonai.
translation: No soap how so much applied, can turn the black blanket into white.

gurmukhi: ਡੇਮੂ ਖਖਰ ਜੋ ਛੁਹੈ ਦਿਸੈ ਮੁਹਿ ਸੂਣੈ
transliteration: Daymoo Khakhar Jo Chhoohai Disai Muhi Soonai.
translation: Whosoever will touch the hive of poisonous wasps will find his face swollen.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੈ ਕੰਮਿ ਨਾ ਅਾਵੲੀ ਲਾਵਣੁ ਬਿਨੁ ਲੂਣੈ
transliteration: Kitai Kanmi N Aavaee Laavanu Binu Loonai.
translation: The cooked vegetable devoid of salt is absolutely useless.

gurmukhi: ਨਿੰਦਕਿ ਨਾਮ ਵਿਸਾਰਿਅਾ ਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਵਿਹੂਣੈ
transliteration: Nidaki Naam Visaariaa Gur Giaanu Vihoonai.
translation: Without the knowledge of the true Guru, the backbiter has neglected the name of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਹਲਤਿ ਪਲਤਿ ਸੁਖੁ ਨਾ ਲਹੈ ਦੁਖੀਅਾ ਸਿਰੁ ਝੂਣੈ ॥੩॥
transliteration: Halati Palati Soukhu Naa Lahai Doukheeaa Siru Jhoonai ?3?
translation: He gets happiness neither here nor there and always laments and repents.

gurmukhi: ੪ ਗੁਰ ਨਿੰਦਾ
translation: Vilification of the Guru

gurmukhi: ਡਾੲਿਣੁ ਮਾਣਸ ਖਾਵਣੀ ਪੁਤੁ ਬੁਰਾ ਨ ਮੰਗੈ
transliteration: Daainu Maanas Khaavanee Poutu Buraa N Mangai.
translation: The witch is man eater but she also does not contemplate wrong for her son.

gurmukhi: ਵਡਾ ਵਿਕਰਮੀ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਧੀ ਭੈਣਹੁ ਸੰਗੈ
transliteration: Vadaa Vikaramee Aakheeai Dhee Bhainahu Sangai.
translation: Even known as the most vicious man, he also feels ashamed before his daughter and sister.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜੇ ਧ੍ਰੋਹੁ ਕਮਾਂਵਦੇ ਰੈਬਾਰ ਸੁਰੰਗੈ
transliteration: Raajay Dhrohu Kamaanvaday Raibaar Surangai.
translation: The kings, trecherous for each other, put no harm to the amabassadors (and they live comfortably).

gurmukhi: ਬਜਰ ਪਾਪ ਨ ੳੁਤਰਨਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੀਚਨਿ ਗੰਗੈ
transliteration: Bajar Paap N Outarani Jaai Keechani Gangai.
translation: The sins committed at Ganges (the religious places) are as hard as the thunderbolt and never fade out.

gurmukhi: ਥਰਹਰ ਕੰਬੈ ਨਰਕੁ ਜਮੁ ਸੁਣਿ ਨਿੰਦਕ ਢੰਗੈ
transliteration: Darahar Kanbai Naraku Jamu Souni Nidak Nagai.
translation: Listening to the naked meanness of the slanderer, Yama of the hell also trembles.

gurmukhi: ਨਿੰਦਾ ਭਲੀ ਨ ਕਿਸੈ ਦੀ ਗੁਰ ਨਿੰਦ ਕੁਢੰਗੈ ॥੪॥
transliteration: Nidaa Bhalee N Kisai Dee Gur Nid Kuddhangai ?4?
translation: Backbiting of any one is bad but the vilification of the Guru is the worst (way of life).

gurmukhi: ੫ ਗੁਰ ਨਿੰਦਾ ਦੇ ਦ੍ਰਿਸ਼ਟਾਂਤ
translation: Examples of Guru's vilification

gurmukhi: ਨਿੰਦਾ ਕਰਿ ਹਰਣਾਖਸੈ ਵੇਖਹੁ ਫਲੁ ਵਟੇ
transliteration: Nidaa Kari Harakhaanasai Vaykhahu Phalu Vatai.
translation: Hirrtyakyapu talked adversely about God and the result gained is clear that he eventually got killed.

gurmukhi: ਲੰਕ ਲੁਟਾੲੀ ਰਾਵਣੈ ਮਸਤਕਿ ਦਸ ਕਟੇ
transliteration: Lak Loutaaee Raavanai Masataki Das Katai.
translation: Ravan also for the same reason got Lanka looted and his ten heads slayed.

gurmukhi: ਕੰਸੁ ਗੲਿਅਾ ਸਣ ਲਸਕਰੈ ਸਭ ਦੈਤ ਸੰਘਟੇ
transliteration: Kansu Gaiaa San Lasakarai Sabh Dait Sanghatai.
translation: Kans was killed along with his full army and his all the demons perished.

gurmukhi: ਵੰਸੁ ਗਵਾੲਿਅਾ ਕੈਰਵਾਂ ਖੂਹਣਿ ਲਖ ਫਟੇ
transliteration: Vansu Gavaaiaa Kairavaan Khoohani Lakh Dhatai.
translation: The Kauravas lost their dynasty and got their myriads of army destroyed.

gurmukhi: ਦੰਤ ਬਕਤ੍ਰ ਸਿਸਪਾਲ ਦੇ ਦੰਦ ਹੋੲੇ ਖਟੇ
transliteration: Dant Bakatr Sisapaal Day Dand Hoay Khatai.
translation: For the same reason, Dantavaktr and Siupál got crushing defeat.

gurmukhi: ਨਿੰਦਾ ਕੋੲਿ ਨ ਸਿਝਿਓ ੲਿੳੁ ਵੇਦ ੳੁਘਟੇ
transliteration: Nidaa Koi N Sijhiao Iu Vayd Oughatai.
translation: The Vedas also dilineate that no success is possible through back-biting

gurmukhi: ਦੁਰਬਾਸੇ ਨੇ ਸਰਾਪ ਦੇ ਯਾਦਵ ਸਭ ਤਟੇ ॥੫॥
transliteration: Durabaasay Nay Saraap Day Yaadav Sabhi Tatai ?5?
translation: . (Due to this vilification) Durvasà. cursed Yadays and vanquished them all.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਗੁਰ ਦੀ ਗਣਤ ਗਣਨ ਵਾਲਾ ਦੁਖੀ
translation: Guru's fault finder always suffers

gurmukhi: ਸਭਨਾ ਦੇ ਸਿਰ ਗੁੰਦੀਅਨਿ ਗੰਜੀ ਗੁਰੜਾਵੈ
transliteration: Sabhanaan Day Sir Goundeeani Ganjee Gurarhaavai.
translation: The hairs of all are dressed but the bald lady mumbles.

gurmukhi: ਕੰਨਿ ਤਨੳੁੜੇ ਕਾਮਣੀ ਬੂੜੀ ਬਰਿੜਾਵੇ
transliteration: Kanni Tanaurhay Kaamanee Boorhee Barirhaavai.
translation: The beautiful woman wears the earnings but the earless one grumbles.

gurmukhi: ਨਥਾਂ ਨਕਿ ਨਵੇਲੀਅਾਂ ਨਕਟੀ ਨ ਸੁਖਾਵੈ
transliteration: Nadaan Naki Navayleeaan Nakatee N Soukhaavai.
translation: The newly wed girls wear nose rings but the noseless feels uncomfortable (for not being able to wear nose ring).

gurmukhi: ਕਜਲ ਅਖੀ ਹਰਣਾਖੀਅਾਂ ਕਾਣੀ ਕੁਰਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Kajal Akheen Haranaakheeaan Kaanee Kuralaavai.
translation: The deer-eyed ladies put in the collyrium but the one-eyed wails and cries.

gurmukhi: ਸਭਨਾ ਚਾਲ ਸੁਹਾਵਣੀ ਲੰਗੜੀ ਲੰਗੜਾਵੈ
transliteration: Sabhanaan Chaal Suhaavanee Lagarhee Lagarhaavai.
translation: All have a pleasing gait but the lame limps.

gurmukhi: ਗਣਤ ਗਣੈ ਗੁਰਦੇਵ ਦੀ ਤਿਸੁ ਦੁਖਿ ਵਿਹਾਵੈ ॥੬॥
transliteration: Ganat Ganai Guradayv Dee Tisu Doukhi Vihaavai ?6?
translation: Those who slander the Guru, spend their life in sorrows.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਗੁਰੂ ਨਿੰਦਕ ਦਾ ਜਨਮ ਅਕਾਰਥ
translation: The life of Guru-slanderer is meaningless

gurmukhi: ਅਪਤੁ ਕਰੀਰੁ ਨਾ ਮੳੁਲੀਅੈ ਦੇ ਦੋਸੁ ਬਸੰਤੈ
transliteration: Apatu Kareeru N Mauleeai Day Dosu Basantai.
translation: The leafless wild caper Karin does not grow green but it blames the spring season.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਢਿ ਸਪੁਤੀ ਨਾ ਥੀਅੈ ਕਣਤਾਵੈ ਕੰਤੈ
transliteration: Sanddhi Sapoutee N Deeai Kanataavai Kantai.
translation: The barren women does not bear the child but she blames her husband.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਰਿ ਖੇਤੁ ਨਾ ਜੰਮੲੀ ਘਣਹਰੁ ਵਰਸੰਤੈ
transliteration: Kalari Khaytu N Janmaee Ghanaharu Varasantai.
translation: The rains of the clouds cannot make alkaline field grow and produce.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਗਾ ਪਿਛੈ ਚੰਗਿਅਾਂ ਅਵਗੁਣ ਗੁਣਵੰਤੈ
transliteration: Pangaa Pichhai Changiaan Avagoun Gounavantai.
translation: The meritorious people get evils and embarrassments in the company of vicious people.

gurmukhi: ਸਾੲਿਰੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਘੰਘੂਟਿਅਾਂ ਬਹੁ ਰਤਨ ਅਨੰਤੈ
transliteration: Saairu Vichi Ghanghootiaan Bahu Ratan Anatai.
translation: In the ocean, one gets many a pearl even from the shells, i.e. the association with the good produces good results.

gurmukhi: ਜਨਮ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਅਕਾਰਥਾ ਗੁਰੁ ਗਣਤ ਗਣੰਤੈ ॥੭॥
transliteration: Janam Gavaai Akaaradaa Guru Ganat Ganantai ?7?
translation: Slandering the Guru, the whole life elapses in vain.

gurmukhi: ੮ ਅਕਿਰਤਘਣ
translation: The ungrateful

gurmukhi: ਨਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਭਾਰੇ ਪਰਬਤਾਂ ਅਸਮਾਨ ਖਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Naa Tisu Bhaaray Parabataan Asamaan Khahanday.
translation: The sky-touching mountains also are not of much weight (than the ungrateful person).

gurmukhi: ਨਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਭਾਰੇ ਕੋਟ ਗੜ੍ਹ ਘਰਬਾਰ ਦਿਸੰਦੇ
transliteration: Naa Tisu Bhaaray Kot Garhh Ghar Baar Disanday.
translation: The visible forts are also not as weighty as he (the ungrateful person) is;

gurmukhi: ਨਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਭਾਰੇ ਸਾੲਿਰਾਂ ਨਦ ਵਾਹ ਵਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Naa Tisu Bhaaray Saairaan Nad Vaah Vahanday.
translation: Those oceans in which will the rivers merge are also not as heavy as he is;

gurmukhi: ਨਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਭਾਰੇ ਤਰੁਵਰਾਂ ਫਲ ਸੁਫਲ ਫਲੰਦੇ
transliteration: Naa Tisu Bhaaray Taruvaraan Phal Suphal Phaladay.
translation: The fruit laden trees are also not as heavy as he is

gurmukhi: ਨਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਭਾਰੇ ਜੀਅਜੰਤ ਅਣਗਣਤ ਫਿਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Naa Tisu Bhaaray Jeea Jant Anaganat Dhiranday.
translation: And nor those innumerable creatures are as heavy as he is.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਰੇ ਭੁੲੀਂ ਅਕਿਰਤਘਣ ਮੰਦੀ ਹੂ ਮੰਦੇ ॥੮॥
transliteration: Bhaaray Bhueen Akirataghan Mandee Hoo Manday.
translation: In fact the ungrateful person is burden on earth and he is evil of evils.

gurmukhi: ੯ ਅਕਿਰਤਘਣ
translation: Example of an ungrateful

gurmukhi: ਮਦ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਿਧਾ ਪਾੲਿਕੈ ਕੁਤੇ ਦਾ ਮਾਸੁ
transliteration: Mad Vichi Ridhaa Paai Kai Koutay Daa Maasu.
translation: The meat of dog cooked in the wine was, along with its foul smell, kept in the human skull.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਿਅਾ ਮਾਣਸ ਖੋਪਰੀ ਤਿਸੁ ਮੰਦੀ ਵਾਸੁ
transliteration: Dhariaa Maanas Khoparee Tisu Mandee Vaasu.
translation: It was covered with the blood stained cloth.

gurmukhi: ਰਤੂ ਭਰਿਅਾ ਕਪੜਾ ਕਰਿ ਕਜਣੁ ਤਾਸੁ
transliteration: Ratoo Bhariaa Kaparhaa Kari Kajanu Taasu.
translation: Covering thus, the scavenger woman (chi:than) after appeasing her lust was carrying that bowl.

gurmukhi: ਢਕਿ ਲੈ ਚਲੀ ਚੂਹੜੀ ਕਰਿ ਭੋਗ ਬਿਲਾਸੁ
transliteration: Ddhaki Lai Chalee Chooharhee Kari Bhog Bilaasu.
translation: On being asked about (the abominable covered material)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਖਿ ਸੁਣਾੲੇ ਪੁਛਿਅਾ ਲਾਹੇ ਵਿਸਵਾਸੁ
transliteration: Aakhi Sounaaay Pouchhiaa Laahay Visavaasu.
translation: She cleared the doubt by saying that she had covered the meat to hide

gurmukhi: ਨਦਰੀ ਪਵੈ ਅਕਿਰਤਘਣੁ ਮਤੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਵਿਣਾਸੁ ॥੯॥
transliteration: Nadaree Pavai Akirataghanu Matu Hoi Vinaasu ?9?
translation: It from the sight of an ungrateful person to avoid its pollution.

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਲੂਣ ਹਰਾਮੀ
translation: The ungrateful

gurmukhi: ਚੋਰੁ ਗੲਿਅਾ ਘਰਿ ਸਾਹ ਦੈ ਘਰ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਵੜਿਅਾ
transliteration: Choru Gaiaa Ghari Saah Dai Ghar Andari Varhiaa.
translation: A thief entered the house of a rich person.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਛਾ ਕੂਣੈ ਭਾਲਦਾ ਚੳੁਬਾਰੇ ਚੜ੍ਹਿਅਾ
transliteration: Kouchhaa Koonai Bhaaladaa Chaoubaaray Charhhiaa.
translation: Carefully watching the four corners he came to the upper room.

gurmukhi: ਸੁੲਿਨਾ ਰੁਪਾ ਪੰਡ ਬੰਨ੍ਹਿ ਅਗਲਾੲੀ ਅੜਿਅਾ
transliteration: Suinaa Roupaa Pand Bannhi Agalaaee Arhiaa.
translation: He gathered the money and gold and tied them in a bundle; but still his greed delayed him.

gurmukhi: ਲੋਭ ਲਹਰਿ ਹਲਕਾੲਿਅਾ ਲੂਣ ਹਾਂਡਾ ਫੜਿਅਾ
transliteration: Lobh Lahari Halakaaiaa Loon Haandaa Dharhiaa.
translation: Getting impatient in greed he caught hold of a salt-pot.

gurmukhi: ਚੁਖਕੁ ਲੈ ਕੇ ਚਖਿਅਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਕਖੁ ਨ ਖੜਿਅਾ
transliteration: Choukhaku Lai Kay Chakhiaa Tisu Kakhu N Kharhiaa.
translation: A bit of it he took out and tasted; he left every thing there and came, out.

gurmukhi: ਲੂਣ ਹਰਾਮੀ ਗੁਨਹਗਾਰੁ ਧੜੁ ਧੰਮੜ ਧੜਿਅਾ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Loon Haraamee Gounahagaaru Dharhu Dhanmarh Dharhiaa ?10?
translation: That thief also knew, that an ungrateful person is beaten like a drum (in the Lord's court).

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਲੂਣ ਖਾਣਿਅਾਂ ਦੀ ਗਿਣਤੀ
translation: The number of the faithful ones

gurmukhi: ਖਾਧੇ ਲੂਣ ਗੁਲਾਮ ਹੋੲਿ ਪੀਹਿ ਪਾਣੀ ਢੋਵੈ
transliteration: Khaadhay Loon Gulaam Hoi Peehi Paanee Ddhovai.
translation: Having eaten the salt (of a person), man becoming servant fetches water and grinds the corn.

gurmukhi: ਲੂਣ ਖਾੲਿ ਕਰਿ ਚਾਕਰੀ ਰਣਿ ਟੁਕ ਟੁਕ ਹੋਵੈ
transliteration: Loon Khaai Kari Chaakaree Rani Touk Touk Hovai.
translation: Such a faithful, in the battlefield gets killed piece to piece for the master.

gurmukhi: ਲੂਣ ਖਾੲਿ ਧੀ ਪੁਤੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਭ ਲਜਾ ਧੋਵੈ
transliteration: Loon Khaai Dhee Poutu Hoi Sabh Lajaa Dhovai.
translation: The faithful sons and daughters wash all the shames of the family.

gurmukhi: ਲੂਣੁ ਵਣੋਟਾ ਖਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਹਥ ਜੋੜਿ ਖੜੋਵੈ
transliteration: Loonu Vanotaa Khaai Kai Had Jorhi Kharhovai.
translation: The salt eater servant always stands with folded hands.

gurmukhi: ਵਾਟ ਵਟਾੳੂ ਲੂਣੁ ਖਾੲਿ ਗੁਣੁ ਕੰਠਿ ਪਰੋਵੈ
transliteration: Vaat Vataaoo Loonu Khaai Gounu Kantdi Parovai.
translation: The passerby eulogizes the person whose salt be has eaten.

gurmukhi: ਲੂਣ ਹਰਾਮੀ ਗੁਨਹਗਾਰ ਮਰਿ ਜਨਮੁ ਵਿਗੋਵੈ ॥੧੧॥
transliteration: Loon Haraamee Gounahagaar Mari Janamu Vigovai ?11?
translation: But the ungrateful person commits sins and he loses his life in vain and dies.

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ਧਰਮਸਾਲ ਦੀ ਝਾਕ
translation: Expectation from a religious place

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਮਿਰਜਾਦਾ ਹਿੰਦੂਅਾਂ ਗੳੂ ਮਾਸੁ ਅਖਾਜੁ
transliteration: Jiu Mirayaadaa Hindooaa Gaoo Maasu Akhaaju.
translation: As the cow meat is forbidden in Hindu code of conduct;

gurmukhi: ਮੁਸਲਮਾਣਾ ਸੂਅਰਹੁ ਸੳੁਗੰਦ ਵਿਅਾਜੁ
transliteration: Mousalamaanaan Sooarahu Saougand Viaaju.
translation: The Musalmans pledge against the pork and the interest on money;

gurmukhi: ਸਹੁਰਾ ਘਰਿ ਜਾਵਾੲੀਅੈ ਪਾਣੀ ਮਦ ਰਾਜੁ
transliteration: Sahuraa Ghari Javaaeeai Paanee Mudaraaju.
translation: For father-in-law, even the water of the house of son-in-law is prohibited like the wine;

gurmukhi: ਸਹਾ ਨ ਖਾੲੀ ਚੂਹੜਾ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਮੁਹਤਾਜੁ
transliteration: Sahaa N Khaaee Chooharhaa Maaiaa Muhataaju.
translation: The scanvenger eats not rabbit, though he be hard of money;

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਮਿਠੈ ਮਖੀ ਮਰੈ ਤਿਸੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਕਾਜੁ
transliteration: Jiu Mitdai Makhee Marai Tisu Hoi Akaaju.
translation: As the dead fly makes the taste of sweet bad and the sweet getting poisonous becomes useless,

gurmukhi: ਤਿੳੁ ਧਰਮਸਾਲ ਦੀ ਝਾਕ ਹੈ ਵਿਹੁ ਖੰਡੂਪਾਜੁ ॥੧੨॥
transliteration: Tiu Dharamasaal Dee Jhaak Hai Vihu Khandoo Paaju ?12?
translation: Similarly to set one's eye upon the earning of the religious place is like eating of sugar coated poison.

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਝਾਕ - ਪੂਜਾ ਦਾ ਧਾਨ
translation: Desire from the earning of the religious place -

gurmukhi: ਖਰਾ ਦੁਹੇਲਾ ਜਗ ਵਿਚਿ ਜਿਸ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਝਾਕੁ
transliteration: Kharaa Duhaylaa Jag Vichi Jis Andari Jhaaku.
translation: He is ever sorrowful who has craving in his mind.

gurmukhi: ਸੋੲਿਨੇ ਨੋ ਹਥੁ ਪਾੲਿਦਾ ਹੁੲਿ ਵੰਞਞਞਞੈ ਖਾਕੁ
transliteration: Soinay No Hadu Paaidaa Hui Vanai Khaaku.
translation: He touches the gold and that turns into the lump of soil.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਠ ਮਿਤ ਪੁਤ ਭਾੲਿਰਾ ਵਿਹਰਨਿ ਸਭ ਸਾਕੁ
transliteration: Itd Mit Pout Bhaairaa Viharani Sabh Saaku.
translation: Dear friends, sons, brothers, and all other relatives become unhappy with him.

gurmukhi: ਸੋਗੁ ਵਿਜੋਗੁ ਸਰਾਪੁ ਹੈ ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਨਾਪਾਕੁ
transliteration: Sogu Vijogu Saraapu Hai Duramati Naapaaku.
translation: Such evil-minded person ever suffers the curse of meeting and separation i.e. he undergoes the sufferings of transmigration.

gurmukhi: ਵਤੈ ਮੁਤੜਿ ਰੰਨ ਜਿੳੁ ਦਰਿ ਮਿਲੈ ਤਲਾਕੁ
transliteration: Vatai Moutarhi Rann Jiu Dari Milai Talaaku.
translation: He wanders like an abandoned woman and stands divorced from the door (of the Lod).

gurmukhi: ਦੁਖੁ ਭੁਖੁ ਦਾਲਿਦ ਘਣਾ ਦੋਜਕ ਅੳੁਤਾਕੁ ॥੧੩॥
transliteration: Doukhu Bhoukhu Daalid Ghanaa Dojak Aoutaaku ?13?
translation: He gets distress, hunger, profuse poverty and reaches hell after the (bodily) death.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ਪੂਜਾ ਦਾ ਧਾਨ
translation: Earnings of worship

gurmukhi: ਵਿਗੜੈ ਚਾਟਾ ਦੁਧ ਦਾ ਕਾਂਜੀ ਦੀ ਚੁਖੈ
transliteration: Vigarhai Chaataa Dudh Daa Kaanjee Dee Choukhai.
translation: The full pot of milk gets spoiled by a drop of vinegar.

gurmukhi: ਸਹਸ ਮਣਾ ਰੂੲੀ ਜਲੈ ਚਿਣਗਾਰੀ ਧੁਖੈ
transliteration: Sahas Manaa Rooee Jalai Chinagaaree Dhoukhai.
translation: The thousand mounds of cotton are burnt by one spark.

gurmukhi: ਬੂਰੁ ਵਿਣਾਹੇ ਪਾਣੀਅੈ ਖੳੁ ਲਾਖਹੁ ਰੁਖੈ
transliteration: Booru Vinaahay Paaneeai Khau Laakhahu Roukhai.
translation: The water gossamer spoils water and the shellac becomes the reason for the destruction of the tree.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ੳੁਦਮਾਦੀ ਅਤੀਸਾਰੁ ਖੲੀ ਰੋਗੁ ਮਨੁਖੈ
transliteration: Jiu Udamaadee Ateesaaru Khaee Rogu Manoukhai.
translation: The mad man is mined by diarrhoea and the common man is destroyed by tuberculosis (consumption).

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਜਾਲਿ ਪੰਖੇਰੂ ਫਾਸਦੇ ਚੁਗਣ ਦੀ ਭੁਖੈ
transliteration: Jiu Jaali Pankhayroo Dhaasaday Chougan Dee Bhoukhai.
translation: As the birds get entangled in the net out of their greed for seeds,

gurmukhi: ਤਿੳੁ ਅਜਰੁ ਝਾਕ ਭੰਡਾਰ ਦੀ ਵਿਅਾਪੇ ਵੇਮੁਖੈ ॥੧੪॥
transliteration: Tiu Ajaru Jhaak Bhandaar Dee Viaapay Vaymoukhai ?14?
translation: The desire for the storage of unendurable (earning from the religious place) persists in the heart of the apostate.

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਪੂਜਾ ਦਾ ਧਾਨ ਕਿੱਕੂੰ ਪਚੇ
translation: How earnings of worship could be digested     ?

gurmukhi: ਅੳੁਚਰੁ ਝਾਕ ਭੰਡਾਰ ਦੀ ਚੁਖੁ ਲਗੈ ਚਖੀ
transliteration: Aoucharu Jhaak Bhandaar Dee Choukhu Lagai Chakhee.
translation: To crave for the material of store (for the Sikhs) is improper.

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਦੁਕੁਧਾ ਨਿਕਲੈ ਭੋਜਨੁ ਮਿਲਿ ਮਖੀ
transliteration: Hoi Doukudhaa Nikalai Bhojanu Mili Makhee.
translation: But those who have such a desire, have to return the material, as the fly gone inside with food is vomited out by the body.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਤਿ ਸੁਖਾਲਾ ਕਿੳੁ ਸਵੈ ਤਿਣੁ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਅਖੀ
transliteration: Raati Soukhaalaa Kiu Savai Tinu Andari Akhee.
translation: How could he sleep peacefully who has the grass blade in his eye.

gurmukhi: ਕਖਾ ਦਬੀ ਅਗਿ ਜਿੳੁ ਓਹੁ ਰਹੈ ਨ ਰਖੀ
transliteration: Kakhaa Dabee Agi Jiu Aohu Rahai N Rakhee.
translation: As the fire cannot be kept pressed under the dry grass, similarly,

gurmukhi: ਝਾਕ ਝਕਾੲੀਅੈ ਝਾਕਵਾਲੁ ਕਰਿ ਭਖ ਅਭਖੀ
transliteration: Jhaak Jhakaaeeai Jhaakavaalu Kari Bhakh Abhakhee.
translation: The cravings of the caving person cannot be controlled and for him the inedible becomes edible.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪਰਸਾਦੀ ੳੁਬਰੇ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖਾ ਲਖੀ ॥੧੫॥
transliteration: Gur Parasaadee Oubaray Gur Sikhaa Lakhee ?15?
translation: The Sikhs of the Guru are millions but only those who attain the grace of the Lord get across  the world ocean).

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਧਰਮਸਾਲ ਝਾਕੀਅਾਂ ਦਾ ਲੱਛਣ
translation: The marks of the religious-earning-grabbers

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਘੁਣ ਖਾਧੀ ਲਕੜੀ ਵਿਣੁ ਤਾਣਿ ਨਿਤਾਣੀ
transliteration: Jiu Ghoun Khaadhee Lakarhee Vinu Taani Nitaanee.
translation: He (the apostate) becomes feeble and powerless as the weevil-eaten wood.

gurmukhi: ਜਾਣੁ ਡਰਾਵਾ ਖੇਤ ਵਿਚਿ ਨਿਰਜੀੳੁ ਪਰਾਣੀ
transliteration: Jaanu Daraavaa Khayt Vichi Nirajeetu Paraanee.
translation: He is similar to the life-less scarecrow put up in the field to frighten (the birds).

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਧੂਅਰੁ ਝੜੁਵਾਲ ਦੀ ਕਿੳੁ ਵਰਸੈ ਪਾਣੀ
transliteration: Jiu Dhooaru Jharhuvaal Dee Kiu Varasai Paanee.
translation: How out of clouds of smoke rain could take place.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਥਣ ਗਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਬਕਰੀ ਦੁਹਿ ਦੁਧੁ ਨਾ ਅਾਣੀ
transliteration: Jiu Dan Gal Vichi Bakaree Duhi Dudhu N Aanee.
translation: As the teat of a goat in the neck cannot give milk, likewise the grabber of religious earning of a religious place roams hither and thither in the craving of the same.

gurmukhi: ਝਾਕੇ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਝਾਕਵਾਲੁ ਤਿਸ ਕਿਅਾ ਨੀਸਾਣੀ
transliteration: Jhaakay Andari Jhaakavaalu Tis Kiaa Neesaanee.
translation: What is the exact mark of such a man.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਚਮੁਚਟੈ ਗਾੲਿ ਮਹਿ ੳੁਹ ਭਰਮਿ ਭੁਲਾਣੀ ॥੧੬॥
transliteration: Jiu Chamu Chatai Gaai Mahi Uh Bharami Bhulaanee ?16?
translation: Such a man remains deluded like that cow who considering its dead offspiring alive goes on licking it

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਸਾਧ ਅਸਾਧ ਪ੍ਰੀਛਾ
translation: Test of the saint and the renegade

gurmukhi: ਗੁਛਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਧ੍ਰਿਕਾਨੂਅਾ ਕਿੳੁ ਵੁੜੀਅੈ ਦਾਖੈ
transliteration: Gouchhaa Hoi Dhrikaanooaa Kiu Varheeai Daakhai.
translation: Why should the bunch of the bead tree be compared with grapes.

gurmukhi: ਅਕੈ ਕੇਰੀ ਖਖੜੀ ਕੋੲੀ ਅੰਬੁ ਨਾ ਅਾਖੈ
transliteration: Akai Kayree Khakharhee Koee Anbu N Aakhai.
translation: No one calls the akk berries, mango.

gurmukhi: ਗਹਣੇ ਜਿੳੁਂ ਜਰਪੋਸ ਦੇ ਨਹੀ ਸੋੲਿਨਾ ਸਾਖੈ
transliteration: Gahanay Jiu Jarapos Day Nahee Soinaa Saakhai.
translation: Gift ornaments are not like golden ornaments.

gurmukhi: ਫਟਕ ਨ ਪੁਜਨਿ ਹੀਰਿਅਾ ਓੲਿ ਭਰੇ ਬਿਅਾਖੈ
transliteration: Dhatak N Pujani Heeriaa Aoi Bharay Biaakhai.
translation: Crystals are not equal to diamonds because the diamonds are costlier.

gurmukhi: ਧੳੁਲੇ ਦਿਸਨਿ ਛਾਹਿ ਦੁਧੁ ਸਾਦਹੁ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਖੈ
transliteration: Dhaulay Disani Chhaahi Dudhu Saadahu Goun Gaakhai.
translation: Butter milk and milk are both white but of different quality and taste

gurmukhi: ਤਿੳੁ ਸਾਧ ਅਸਾਧ ਪਰਖੀਅਨਿ ਕਰਤੂਤਿ ਸੁ ਭਾਖੈ ॥੧੭॥
transliteration: Tiu Saadh Asaadh Parakheeani Karatooti Su Bhaakhai ?17?
translation: Similarly, the holy and unholy are distinguished by their attributes and activities.

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਚਾਰ ਵਰਣ ਦਾ ਸਾਧ
translation: The saints among the four varnas

gurmukhi: ਸਾਵੇ ਪੀਲੇ ਪਾਨ ਹਹਿ ਓੲਿ ਵੇਲਹੁ ਤੁਟੈ
transliteration: Saavay Peelay Paan Hahi Aoi Vaylahu Toutay.
translation: The betel leaves when plucked from the branch are of green and yellow colour.

gurmukhi: ਚਿਤਮਿਤਾਲੇ ਫੋਫਲੇ ਫਲ ਬਿਰਖਹੁਂ ਛੁਟੈ
transliteration: Chitamitaalay Dhophalay Phal Birakhahoun Chhoutay.
translation: The betel nut getting pie bald colour is plucked from the tree.

gurmukhi: ਕਥ ਹੁਰੇਹੀ ਭੂਸਲੀ ਦੇ ਚਾਵਲ ਚੁਟੈ
transliteration: Kad Harayhee Bhoosalee Day Chaaval Choutay.
translation: The catechu is of brown colour and light and a pinch of it is used.

gurmukhi: ਚੂਨਾ ਦਿਸੈ ੳੁਜਲਾ ਦਹਿ ਪਥਰੁ ਕੁਟੈ
transliteration: Choonaa Disai Ujalaa Dahi Padaru Koutay.
translation: The lime is white and is burnt and thrashed.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਸਮਾੲਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਰੰਗੁ ਚੀਚ ਵਹੁਟੈ
transliteration: Aapu Gavaai Samaai Mili Rangu Cheech Vahoutay.
translation: When losing their ego (they meet) they uniformally become of red colour.

gurmukhi: ਤਿੳੁ ਚਹੁ ਵਰਨਾ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਾਧ ਹਨਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮੁਹ ਜੁਟੈ ॥੧੮॥
transliteration: Tiu Chahu Varanaa Vichi Saadh Hani Guramoukhi Muh Joutay ?18?
translation: Likewise are the saints, who adopting the qualifies of the four varnas, live in mutual love like gmmukhs, the Guru oriented.

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਸਾਂਗੀ ਸਾਧ
translation: Hypocrite saint

gurmukhi: ਚਾਕਰ ਸਭ ਸਦਾੲਿਂਦੇ ਸਾਹਿਬ ਦਰਬਾਰੇ
transliteration: Chaakar Sabh Sadaainday Saahib Darabaaray.
translation: In the court of the emperor all are known as servants.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਵਿ ਨਿਵਿ ਕਰਨਿ ਜੁਹਾਰੀਅਾ ਸਭ ਸੈ ਹਥੀਅਾਰੇ
transliteration: Nivi Nivi Karani Juhaareeaa Sabh Saihadeeaaray.
translation: Armed well, they bow most humbly.

gurmukhi: ਮਜਲਸ ਬਹਿ ਬਾਫਾੲਿਂਦੇ ਬੋਲ ਬੋਲਨਿ ਭਾਰੇ
transliteration: Majalas Bahi Baadhaainday Bol Bolani Bhaaray.
translation: In the social and cultural gatherings they boast and brag.

gurmukhi: ਗਲੀੲੇ ਤੁਰੇ ਨਚਾੲਿਂਦੇ ਗਜਗਾਹ ਸਵਾਰੇ
transliteration: Galeeay Turay Nachaainday Gajagaah Savaaray.
translation: They have their elephants decorated and in the streets and bazars they roam with their horses dancing.

gurmukhi: ਰਣ ਵਿਚਿ ਪੲਿਅਾਂ ਜਾਣੀਅਨਿ ਜੋਧ ਭਜਣਹਾਰੇ
transliteration: Ran Vichi Paiaan Jaaneeani Jodh Bhajanahaaray.
translation: But only in the battle field is known who is a valiant fighter and who is to take to his heels.

gurmukhi: ਤਿੳੁ ਸਾਂਗਿ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਪਨਿ ਸਨਮੁਖਾ ਬੇਮੁਖ ਹਤਿਅਾਰੇ ॥੧੯॥
transliteration: Tiu Saangi Siaapani Sanamoukhaan Baymoukh Hatiaaray ?19?
translation: Similar are the apostates, the assassins who disguised as close to the Lord remain around, but ultimately are identified.

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਗੁਰੂ ਸਾਂਗ
translation: The test by the Guru

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਮਾਂ ਹੋਵੈ ਜਾਰਨੀ ਕਿੳੁ ਪੁਤੁ ਪਤਾਰੇ
transliteration: Jay Maan Hovai Jaaranee Kiu Poutu Pataaray.
translation: If the mother is adulteress why should son speak ill of her.

gurmukhi: ਗਾੲੀ ਮਾਣਕੁ ਨਿਗਲਿਅਾ ਪੇਟੁ ਪਾੜਿ ਨ ਮਾਰੇ
transliteration: Gaaee Maanaku Nigaliaa Paytu Paarhi N Maaray.
translation: If a gem is swallowed by a cow, nobody ripps its stomach to get it out.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਪਿਰੁ ਬਹੁ ਘਰੁ ਹੰਢਣਾ ਸਤੁ ਰਖੈ ਨਾਰੇ
transliteration: Jay Piru Bahu Gharu Handdhanaa Satu Rakhai Naaray.
translation: If the husband enjoys (immorally) at many houses, the wife should preserve her chastity.

gurmukhi: ਅਮਰੁ ਚਲਾਵੈ ਚੰਮ ਦੇ ਚਾਕਰ ਵੇਚਾਰੇ
transliteration: Amaru Chalaavai Chanm Day Chaakar Vaychaaray.
translation: If the king exercises dictatorial powers, the servants are helpless before him.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਮਦੁ ਪੀਤਾ ਬਾਮ੍ਹਣੀ ਲੋੲਿ ਲੁਝਣਿ ਸਾਰੇ
transliteration: Jay Madu Peetaa Baamhanee Loi Lujhani Saaray.
translation: If a brahmin woman is drunk, all feel ashamed and donot look up in her face.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਗੁਰ ਸਾਂਗਿ ਵਰਤਦਾ ਸਿਖੁ ਸਿਦਕੁ ਨਹਾਰੇ ॥੨੦॥
transliteration: Jay Gur Saangi Varatadaa Sikhu Sidaku N Haaray ?20?
translation: If the Guru performs a sham, the Sikh should not give up his forebearance.

gurmukhi: ੨੧ ਸਾਂਗ ਵਿਚ ਸਾਬਤ ਵਿਰਲੇ
translation: Rare pass the test

gurmukhi: ਧਰਤੀ ੳੁਪਰਿ ਕੋਟਗੜ ਭੁੲਿਚਾਲ ਕੰਮੰਦੇ
transliteration: Dharatee Oupari Kot Garh Bhuichaal Kamanday.
translation: During the earth quake millions of forts on earth shake and crumble

gurmukhi: ਝਖੜਿ ਅਾੲੇ ਤਰੁਵਰਾ ਸਰਬਤ ਹਲੰਦੇ
transliteration: Jhakharhi Aaay Taruvaraa Sarabat Haladay.
translation: During the storm, all the trees oscillate.

gurmukhi: ਡਵਿ ਲਗੈ ੳੁਜਾੜਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਭ ਘਾਹ ਜਲੰਦੇ
transliteration: Davi Lagai Ujaarhi Vichi Sabh Ghaah Jaladay.
translation: During fire, all sorts of grass in the forests get burnt.

gurmukhi: ਹੜ ਅਾੲੇ ਕਿਨਿ ਥੰਮੀਅਨਿ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ ਵਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Harh Aaay Kini Danmeeani Dareeaau Vahanday.
translation: Who can obstruct flood in the flowing river.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਬਰਿ ਪਾਟੇ ਥਿਗਲੀ ਕੂੜਿਅਾਰ ਕਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Anbari Paatay Digalee Koorhiaar Karanday.
translation: The difficult and foolish task of sewing the torn sky like cloth could be done only by adepts in gossipping.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਂਗੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸਾਬਤੇ ਸੇ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਬੰਦੇ ॥੨੧॥
transliteration: Saangai Andari Saabatay Say Viralay Banday ?21?
translation: Rare are the people who remain completely poised during the sham.

gurmukhi: ੨੨ ਸਾਂਗ ਵਿਚ ਸਾਬਤੀ ਗੁਰੂ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾ ਤੇ
translation: If the Guru performs a sham what a Sikh can do ?

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਮਾੳੁ ਪੁਤੈ ਵਿਸੁ ਦੇ ਤਿਸਤੇ ਕਿਸੁ ਪਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Jay Maau Poutai Visu Day Tis Tay Kisu Piaaraa.
translation: If a mother administers poison to son then to whom else that son could be more dear.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਘਰੁ ਭੰਨੈ ਪਾਹਰੂ ਕੳੁਣੁ ਰਖਣਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Jay Gharu Bhannai Paaharoo Kaounu Rakhanahaaraa.
translation: If the watchman breaks open the house, then, who else could be a protector.

gurmukhi: ਬੇੜੀ ਡੋਬੈ ਪਾਤਣੀ ਕਿੳੁ ਪਾਰਿ ੳੁਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Bayrhaa Dobai Paatanee Kiu Paari Outaaraa.
translation: If the boatman makes the boat sink, how one could get across.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਗੂ ਲੈ ੳੁਝੜਿ ਪਵੈ ਕਿਸੁ ਕਰੈ ਪੁਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Aagoo Lai Ujharhi Pavay Kisu Karai Poukaaraa.
translation: If the leader himself makes the people go astray, who else could be called for help.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਕਰਿ ਖੇਤੈ ਖਾੲਿ ਵਾੜਿ ਕੋ ਲਹੈ ਨ ਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Jay Kari Khaytai Khaai Vaarhi Ko Lahai N Saaraa.
translation: And if the protecting fence starts eating the crops who else will take care of the fields.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਗੁਰ ਭਰਮਾੲੇ ਸਾਂਗੁ ਕਰਿ ਕਿਅਾ ਸਿਖੁ ਵਿਚਾਰਾ ॥੨੨॥
transliteration: Jay Gur Bharamaaay Saangu Kari Kiaa Sikhu Vichaaraa ?22?
translation: Similarly, if the Guru deludes a Sikh through a sham, what a poor Sikh could do.
Only he remains poised in a sham whom the Guru is graceful

gurmukhi: ਜਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਕਾਗਦ ਲੂਣ ਜਿੳੁ ਘਿਅ ਚੋਪੜਿ ਪਾੲੇ
transliteration: Jal Vichi Kaagad Loon Jiu Ghia Choparhi Paaay.
translation: Applying butter to the paper and salt they can be put into water (they will take longer time to dissolve).

gurmukhi: ਦੀਵੇ ਵਟੀ ਤੇਲੁ ਦੇ ਸਭ ਰਾਤਿ ਜਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Deevay Vatee Taylu Day Sabh Raati Jalaaay.
translation: With the help of oil, the wick of the lamp goes on burning the whole night.

gurmukhi: ਵਾੲਿ ਮੰਡਲ ਜਿੳੁ ਡੋਰ ਫੜਿ ਗੁਡੀ ਓਡਾੲੇ
transliteration: Vaai Mandal Jiu Dor Dharhi Gudee Aodaaay.
translation: Catching hold of the string, the kite could be made to fly in the sky.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਹ ਵਿਚਿ ਗਰੜ ਦੁਗਾਰੁ ਪਾੲਿ ਜਿੳੁ ਸਪੁ ਲੜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Muh Vichi Gararh Dougaaru Paai Jiu Sapu Larhaaay.
translation: By keeping an herb in the mouth, one could get bitten by serpent.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜਾ ਫਿਰੈ ਫਕੀਰੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਦੁਖਿ ਮਿਟਾੲੇ
transliteration: Raajaa Dhirai Dhakeeru Hoi Souni Doukhi Mitaaay.
translation: If the king goes out in the guise of a faquire, he could listen to the sufferings of people and remove them.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਂਗੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸਾਬਤਾ ਜਿਸੁ ਗੁਰੂ ਸਹਾੲੇ ॥੨੩॥੩੫॥
transliteration: Saangai Andari Saabataa Jisu Guroo Sahaaay ?23?35?painteeha?
translation: In such a feat only he passes the test who is helped by the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਰੋਮ ਰੋਮ ਕੋਟਿ ਬ੍ਹਿਮਾਂਡ ਕੋ ਨਿਵਾਸ ਜਾਸੁ ਮਾਨਸ ਅੳੁਤਾਰ ਧਾਰ ਦਰਸ ਦਿਖਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Rom Rom Koti Brahimaand Ko Nivaas Jaasu , Maanas Aoutaar Dhaar Daras Dikhaaay Hai ?
translation: Supreme Lord, whose each hair support millions of cosmos has incarnated as Satguru in human form.

gurmukhi: ਜਾ ਕੇ ਓਅੰਕਾਰ ਕੈ ਅਕਾਰ ਹੈ ਨਾਨਾ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਰ ਸ੍ਰੀਮੁਖ ਸਬਦ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖਨੁ ਸੁਨਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaa Kay Aoankaar Kai Akaar Hai Naanaa Prakaara , Sreemoukh Sabad Gur Sikhanu Sounaaay Hai ?
translation: The Omniprotector Lord who has many forms, appearing as Guru has given sermon to his disciples in person.

gurmukhi: ਜਗ ਭੋਗ ਨੲੀਬੇਦ ਜਗਤ ਭਗਤ ਜਾਹਿ ਅਸਨ ਬਸਨ ਗੁਰਸਿਖਨ ਲਡਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jag Bhog Naeebayd Jagat Bhagat Jaahi , Asan Basan Gursikhan Ladaaay Hai ?
translation: The God for whose propitiation yags are performed, food and offerings are made, the same Lord takes the form of Guru now coddling his Sikhs by distributing food and to his disciples.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਗਮ ਸੇਖਾਦਿ ਕਬਤ ਨੇਤ ਨੇਤ ਕਰਿ ਪੂਰਮ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਗੁਰਸਿਖਨੁ ਲਖਾੲੇ ਹੈ ॥੩੫॥
transliteration: Nigam Saykhaadi Kabat Nayt Nayt Kari , Pooram Braham Gursikhanu Lakhaaay Hai ?35?
translation: The supreme Creator, whom Shesh Nag and others have calling by innumerable names, now manifests as Guru showing Himself to His devotees (The Sikhs). (35)
